briefdescription.para: The number of Bits in one Byte.

detaileddescription.para:
Used in functions: setBitFnList getBitFnList setBit
value 8u

briefdescription.para: The number of Bits in one Nibble (half-byte).

detaileddescription.para:
Used in functions: setUpperNibble getUpperNibble
value 4u

briefdescription.para: The mask for extract the lower nibble from the byte value.

detaileddescription.para:
Used in functions: setLowerNibble setUpperNibble getLowerNibble
value 0x0Fu

briefdescription.para: The mask for extract one byte value.
BAP Stack correct return value.
BAP Stack incorrect return value.
Number of 10ms cycles that BAPHandler waits before will perform next check of the adaptations and / or codings.
Number of 10ms cycles that BAPHandler needs to wait before sending any requests to BAP.
Minimal number of 10ms cycles that BAPHandler has to wait before providing Status message after FSG_Control reset.
The length of data array used by BAP_Config functional properitie.
The length of data array used by FunctionList functional properitie.
The length of data array used by FSG_Control functional properitie.
The length of data array used by FSG_OperationState functional properitie.
adaptations and/or codings were not change in compare to last verification
adaptations and/or codings were change in compare to last verification
adaptations and/or codings responsible for FctList were change in compare to last verification
unique state used during first invokee of cyclic function bapi_PSO_ImExport_processPSOverification, to calculate PSO parameters availability during and to not send the ChangeNotification to OCU.

detaileddescription.para: The enum to define the state of Adaptations and Codings readed by BAPHandler

briefdescription.para: initial state used for BAPHandler startup to get latest adaptation and codings
BAPHandler state set when adaptations and codings are ready to be used to configure BAP communication.
BAPHandler state used to indicate end of configuration of BAP protocol and sysytem functionalities - not used.
BAPHandler state used to establish BAP communication.
BAPHandler state used to postpone handling of BAP communicaton of 5 cycles.
most common state of BAPHandler, used to cyclic handling of BAP functionality
BAPHandler state used to indicate ready to go state - not used.
BAPHandler state used to update the BAP properties after adaptation and/or codding change.
BAPHandler state used to update personalized BAP properties after adaptation and/or codding change - not used.
BAPHandler state used to update FctList after adaptation and/or codding change - not used.
BAPHandler state used to reset to defaults BAP properties after receiving FSG_Control request.
BAPHandler state used to indicate end of work - not used.

detaileddescription.para: The enum to define the state of BAPHandler activity

Local version of memcpy standard function, avoiding MISRA warnings.
reentrant No context task context thread safe No - Integration must insure that the function is not interrupted by the other functions of the same module multicore safe No - All APIs needs to be called from the same core synchronous Security Relevance
Not Security-Relevant.
void
* dst_p - pointer to array with specific bit to be set [in] uint8 val - the size of array [in] uint32 num_u32 - value of bit to be set
void
Globals
Affected variables: none
Call Sequence
Test Method
The testing method is described on: TEST_BAPHandler_memset
Traceability
This function satisfies no DOORS Requirements. Design Decision - Justification. Because standard memcmpy function causes MISRA warnings, this function is it;s copy including relevant justification and can be used as an alternative to it to avoid many MISRA warnings.

memberdef.argsstring: (uint8 *data_pu8, uint8 len_u8, uint8 bit_u8, boolean value_b)
memberdef.name: setBitFnList

detaileddescription.para:
Set value of specific bit in array of one bytes values. This function returns the value of specific bit from FunctionList - the array of 8 one bytes elements. If specific bit is out of specified range of bytes, zero / false value is returned.
reentrant No context task context thread safe No - Integration must insure that the function is not interrupted by the other functions of the same module multicore safe No - All APIs needs to be called from the same core synchronous Security Relevance
Not Security-Relevant.
uint8*
byte_pu8 - pointer to array with specific bit to be set [in] uint8 len_u8 - the size of array [in] uint8 bit_u8 - position of the bit to be set
[in] boolean value_b - value of bit to be set
void
Globals
Affected variables: none
Call Sequence
Test Method
The testing method is described on: TEST_setBitFnList
Traceability
This function satisfies no DOORS Requirements. Design Decision - Justification. This is commonly used helper function, designed to setting in easy way selected bit in the BAPHandlers FctList.

Get value of specific bit from array of one bytes values. This function returns the value of specific bit from FunctionList - the array of 8 one bytes elements. If specific bit is out of specified range of bytes, zero / false value is returned.
reentrant No context task context thread safe No - Integration must insure that the function is not interrupted by the other functions of the same module multicore safe No - All APIs needs to be called from the same core synchronous Security Relevance
Not Security-Relevant.
uint8*
byte_pu8 - pointer to array with specific bit to be get [in] uint8 len_u8 - the size of array [in] uint8 bit_u8 - position of the bit to be get
boolean
Globals
Affected variables: none
Call Sequence
Test Method
The testing method is described on: TEST_getBitFnList
Traceability
This function satisfies no DOORS Requirements. Design Decision - Justification. This is commonly used helper function, designed to getting in easy way selected bit from the BAPHandlers FctList.

This function is assigning boolean value to specific bit in one byte value. If specific bit is out of one byte value range, no action is taken.
reentrant No context task context thread safe No - Integration must insure that the function is not interrupted by the other functions of the same module multicore safe No - All APIs needs to be called from the same core synchronous Security Relevance
Not Security-Relevant.
uint8*
byte_pu8 - pointer to byte to set specific bit [in] uint8 bitNumber_u8 - position of the bit to be set [in] boolean value_b - value of bit to be set
void
Globals
Affected variables: none
Call Sequence
Test Method
The testing method is described on: TEST_setBit
Traceability
This function satisfies no DOORS Requirements. Design Decision - Justification. This is commonly used helper function, designed to assign boolean value to selected bit in one byte value.

This function returns the value of specific bit from one byte value. If specific bit is out of one byte value range, zero / false value is returned.
reentrant No context task context thread safe No - Integration must insure that the function is not interrupted by the other functions of the same module multicore safe No - All APIs needs to be called from the same core synchronous Security Relevance
Not Security-Relevant.
uint8
byte_u8 - one bit value with specific bit [in] uint8 bitPos_u8 - position of the bit to be get
boolean
Globals
Affected variables: none
Call Sequence
Test Method
The testing method is described on: TEST_getBit
Traceability
This function satisfies no DOORS Requirements. Design Decision - Justification. This is commonly used helper function, designed to get boolean value of selected bit from one byte value.

Set lower nibble in one byte value. This function is assigning lower nibble from provided value to one byte value pointed by pointer. Only first 4 bits from provided input value are considered. The rest are ignored.
reentrant No context task context thread safe No - Integration must insure that the function is not interrupted by the other functions of the same module multicore safe No - All APIs needs to be called from the same core synchronous Security Relevance
Not Security-Relevant.
uint8*
byte_pu8 - pointer to byte to set lower nibble [in] uint8 value_u8 - value of nibble to be set
void

This function satisfies no DOORS Requirements. Design Decision - Justification. This is helper function, designed to assigning in easy way the lower nibble in one byte value.

Set upper nibble in one byte value. This function is assigning upper nibble from provided value to one byte value pointed by pointer. Only first 4 bits from provided input value are considered. The rest are ignored.

reentrant No context task context thread safe No - Integration must insure that the function is not interrupted by the other functions of the same module multicore safe No - All APIs needs to be called from the same core synchronous Security Relevance

briefdescription.para: This file provides common defines, enums, structures and functions used by BAPHandler SWCs.

detaileddescription.para: This file can be included by other modules
